sentence.Network_en: I eventually got financial backing, but it was a slog.
sentence.Network_cn: 我最终得到了经济支持，但这得来不易。

sentence.Network_en: The men had to slog up a steep muddy incline.
sentence.Network_cn: 人们只得在陡峭而泥泞的斜坡上艰难地行进。

sentence.Network_en: Why should Melissa have to slog around the supermarket on her own?
sentence.Network_cn: 为什么梅利莎会一个人在超市里面费劲地转来转去？

GRE 同义词总结大全 ... toil n．v． 辛苦，辛勤劳作 slog v 猛击，苦干 delve v． 深入探究，钻研.

list.abs: It will be a slog ., 它将是一个长期的难题.
The party leader be slog It out In a tv debate ., 政党领袖在电视辩论中一决雌雄.
it is a long hard slog up the mountain .上山是一段长长的艰难的路。
1. 简单形式参数slogging chisel 凿螺钉头凿-

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 19th cent.: of unknown origin; compare with slug

entry.def: If you slog through something, you work hard and steadily through it.

example.ex: They secure their degrees by slogging through an intensive 11-month course...
example.tran: 他们苦学了 11 个月的强化课程，拿到了学位。

example.ex: She has slogged her way through ballet classes since the age of six...
example.tran: 从 6 岁开始，她就一直在努力地学习芭蕾。

entry.tran: 困难而费力的工作(或任务)
entry.def: If you describe a task as a slog, you mean that it is tiring and requires a lot of effort.

example.ex: I eventually got financial backing, but it was a slog...
example.tran: 我最终得到了经济支持，但这得来不易。

example.ex: There is little to show for the two years of hard slog.
example.tran: 两年的埋头苦干却没有获得什么值得炫耀的结果。

entry.tran: 长途跋涉;步履艰难地行进
entry.def: If you slog somewhere, you make a long and tiring journey there.

example.ex: The men had to slog up a steep muddy incline...
example.tran: 人们只得在陡峭而泥泞的斜坡上艰难地行进。

example.ex: Why should Melissa have to slog around the supermarket on her own?
example.tran: 为什么梅利莎会一个人在超市里面费劲地转来转去？

entry.def: A slog is a long tiring journey.

example.ex: ...a slog through heather and bracken to the top of a hill.
example.tran: 穿过石南和欧洲蕨到达山顶的艰难跋涉

entry.def: If two or more people slog it out, they work very hard to try to be the one who is successful or who has their ideas and wishes accepted.

example.ex: The leading contenders are still slogging it out.
example.tran: 处于领先位置的竞争者仍在激烈地角逐。

sentences.sentence: "She keeps plugging away at her dissertation"

means.word_mean: 2. walk heavily and firmly, as when weary, or through mud;

sentences.sentence: "Mules plodded in a circle around a grindstone"

means.word_mean: 3. strike heavily, especially with the fist or a bat;

sentences.sentence: "He slugged me so hard that I passed out"

auth_sentence.content: However, treatment is a long tedious grueling slog.
auth_sentence.res_content: However, treatment is a long tedious grueling slog.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: However, treatment is a long tedious grueling slog.

auth_sentence.content: It can be a slog to find those managers.
auth_sentence.res_content: It can be a slog to find those managers.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It can be a slog to find those managers.

auth_sentence.content: So how can managers rally employees for the hard slog ahead?
auth_sentence.res_content: So how can managers rally employees for the hard slog ahead?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: So how can managers rally employees for the hard slog ahead?

sentences.en: He slogged away at that report for weeks.
sentences.cn: 他埋头苦干了几个星期写那份报告。

means.word_mean: (人、组织、竞争者等) 决出胜负；决一雌雄；争出个高低

sentences.en: The boxers slugged it out to the finish.
sentences.cn: 两名拳击手最后决出了胜负。

sentences.en: The two teams will slog it out for second place.
sentences.cn: 这两个队将争夺第二名。
